data.text: The new redesign is ok. It takes a few too many taps to get from the front page to being able to view debit/savings and actually do the things the app was built to do. I hate it when big UI updates are rolled out unexpectedly and it's especially jarring when it's something as personal and vital as banking. It makes me fear that policy changes will also be made very suddenly.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback! We are actively collecting all feedback regarding our recent updates from our customers. Rest assured that your input is being shared and heard by our team. Please reach out to us at socialsupport@one.app if we can assist with anything at all. We're here to help!

data.text: Wasn't going to review but the app has become terrible. Stays stuck on loading upon opening the app. I've Uninstalled and reinstalled a couple of times but doesn't fix. All of this started since the latest update. Nothing more disappointing than not being able to check your checking and savings. Not to mention being scammed recently and the dispute being closed within a day after an unauthorized withdrawal and obviously was not in my favor. No number to call, only a "chat". Going back to a bank.
data.replyText: Sincerest apologies. Can you please reach out to us at socialsupport@one.app? We'd like to look into this for you. also you can get in touch with us on ‚òéÔ∏è (855) 830-6200 (9AM - 9PM ET, 7 days a week) / Chat available in app 24/7, so we can look into this for you.

data.text: Dont be mislead, there is no 'instant transfer' option. Its 1 to 3 business days. Unless you want to withdraw cash but it seems more complicated than casting a spell in Wiccan. L Update: well, the transfers aren't instant, but overnight is pretty close enough. And it was my employer w the shady wording. The app works really well and gives you alot of saving options. User interface might have gotten worse since the last update, but thats pretty much every popular app these days. Would recommend!
data.replyText: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you're experiencing with the app. Please contact us at socialsupport@one.app and include the subject line of your review. Thank you!

data.text: My hope is one day they get as good as simple was before they closed. I'm a legacy user so I have a better features than people who are brand new to the app which I appreciate being grandfathered in but I feel everyone should have access to the same features and perks I have. They're slowly bringing back certain features that they removed after the merger but it's getting back to where it was slowly. App can be glitchy at times. Like right now it's not letting me see any of my balance.
data.replyText: We appreciate your feedback and we will share it with our team. We are aware that some customers are currently unable to access the app. Please know that we are working diligently to resolve this issue promptly and restore your full experience.

data.text: Edit. I got a review statement in my email and all it does is send me here to the Google Play store. I love this app, better than Bluebird by American Express. This app has a lot of great features. Not all things are intuitive but I eventually find what I am looking for. Love the 3% in my savings pockets. I haven't yet had an issue. Highly recommend. I'm on an old Android A02s.
data.replyText: Thanks for your review! We appreciate the kind words! üíô

data.text: Update- I've left TWO bad reviews over the years thanks to just awful updates. This one is hardly different. I actually forgot I meant to switch to a different bank. Almost every update breaks the app, functionality, user-friendliness, speed, etc. I truly don't know who is behind these app updates but just stop, you literally had it perfect THREE YEARS AGO. just bring back my dang credit line pocket PLEASE.
data.replyText: Understood. Thank you. We are collecting all feedback regarding recent updates from our customers. It is being shared and heard by our team.

data.text: Overall I like the app but I have problems logging in almost every single time. No matter what time of day it is, I ALWAYS get a message that there was a error and to try in a few moments. Sometimes it ends up taking me over 2 hours to log in. I try with both my email and phone number. But once I'm logged in everything runs smoothly for the most part
data.replyText: Sincerest apologies! We would love to take a look at the issue. Please reach out to us at socialsupport@one.app and include the subject line of your review so we can help. Thanks!

data.text: I love One and do overall like this app, but I have to rate 3 stars because it tells me my full balance between checking AND savings accounts...NOOO!! I spend into my savings EVERYTIME because of this, lol. You guys are the only banking app I've seen do it this way and it's the worst for savings in my opinion and should be changed. You can add all my saving accounts together, sure....but don't add them in with my checking account. It makes it very hard to actually save.
data.replyText: Thank you for sharing your thoughts here. We'd like to know more about your experience with ONE. Please reach out to our team at socialsupport@one.app

data.text: Multiple times have I had the login not work. The app either breaks at the signup screen were clicking login can result in failure or the 2FA just fails to send my confirmation code. The two pages break so consistently that I am effectively locked out of my account and it's not like it's a wait a few moments and it works. It feels like I just have to try again some other day instead. This quite frankly is just unreliable and there's no way I would hold anymore than a couple hundred at a time.
data.replyText: Sincerest apologies! We would love to take a look at the issue. Please reach out to our customer support team at support@one.app so we can help. Thanks!

data.text: When it worked, it was a solid 4-ish stars. As a mobile bank... I have been unable to log in to my account for over an hour. I have reset my phone, mobile data, wifi, cleared cache, uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Infinite loading loop when I try to log in. Not a good look for a BANK APP. Will consider changing review to 4 stars if this gets addressed in a timely manner.
data.replyText: We sincerely apologize for the troubles you're experiencing with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at support@one.app. Thank you!

data.text: Didn't know how to work it at first. Was rough to start up. But now, it's a breeze. Has helped me a lot with finances. Getting my money instantly after a order. I am able to pay any bills. Or transfer to other accounts with ease etc. It's actually a really good app! Finally getting ahead financially, and I think it's almost solely to this. So thanks.
data.replyText: Thanks for your review! We appreciate the kind words! üíô

data.text: Great, easy, and convenient banking app to use! They finally placed in the app the take a pic of check to deposit into account and they fixed the notification issue where at one point there wasn't any transaction notification at all! Now the transaction notification occurs within seconds after any transaction. I like this app!
data.replyText: Thank you for your review! We're glad to hear you're enjoying ONE! üòä

data.text: This used to be a good bank, but not anymore. Ever since Walmart acquired them. When you transfer, it states the obvious by telling you it transferred successfully and you can't do anything I'm the app for a solid 5 seconds. The app text isn't small and neat anymore and discreet. It's big, it's clunky, and ugly. The beautiful colors and ability to make pockets is completely gone. They now are charging different fees. It used to be completely fee free. This app sucks. This bank sucks.
data.replyText: Thank you for sharing your thoughts and feedback with us! We really appreciate it. Rest assured, we will pass this along to our team. If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at socialsupport@one.app.

data.text: When one started some things were missing like mobile check deposit, a way to send a one time check, etc. They got better and added features all the time. Then Walmart purchased them and they have regressed significantly, removing features they added, removing features they started with, lowering rates, and generally making things worse. The app is also more unreliable then ever. Stay away.

Switched over several months ago and LOVED One! Just about everything was perfect and I felt on top of the world taking charge of my finances, being so responsible. This latest update sucks. üôÉ It's not even an update, literally nothing is improving. Honestly, it's just a downgrade. üëéüèº Assigning the card to a specific pocket was everything to me, to help me keep my budgets. Now they've removed that feature (and others) which will make it so much more of a hassle to stay on track.

When I started using ONE, its main draw was the pocket system and the ability to switch the debit card to whatever pocket I wished. Now, not only is that gone, but so is autosave and half of what made ONE different from any other bank. On top of all this, the UI has changed from something slightly restrictive but serviceable to completely oversimplified and difficult to navigate. At this point, the only reason I have to keep using ONE is the fact that pockets can still be shared with others.

Like many, I came from Simple. So far I like the similarities ONE has when it comes to budgeting and user-friendly accommodation. I did have a little issue with notifications, but I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and it seems to be working now (Android User). A couple of things to request to make this the next top tier in mobile financing: 1. Dark Mode (Many people mentioned this, but I'll be another one) 2. Widget for Home screen - It would be great for a quick view of balances for your account. Because you have more than one option for accounts, it would also be great to have a customizable setting for default views of either SPEND, SAVINGS, or Specialized pockets. 3. 4-digit MOBILE pin login instead of Password/email login. This is faster than entering both the email and password, and can be offered as an alternate security login for users. 4. Please change the account values from Total Cash to SPEND for the main balance shown. It can be confusing when looking at the Total Cash front and center when it's containing values from Savings and other pockets. Those are separate from spend and therefore shouldn't count as available to spend. I haven't set up my direct deposit as of now, but when I do, I'll do an update on my final review. I know this is all fairly new, but I do hope my requests are taken into consideration. Thank you!

Major step backwards in terms of the UI on the latest update. Not a fan. Recent annoyance. Transferring funds between pockets doesn't default the "from" pocket to the one you're in when you initiate the xfer. It's defaults to my savings, so I have to remember to change that before the xfer otherwise I have to then go and move money twice. Yes, I should double check, but this is an easy convenient fix that I'm certain hasn't always behaved this way

1 step forward, 2 steps back. The last version of the app had ok UI, a little cluttered, but it worked just fine. This "new" version is more streamlined, but only when I can actually log-in. It seems like every other time I try to get my balance, (because the ONE widget is no longer to be found, -2 points for inconvenience) I get an error of some kind. Either there's no text message with 1 time code or the app just rejects my password. I have no serious complaints with ONE banks. Fix the app!

This bank is only getting worse. I enjoyed it for a while, the pockets feature was cool, the credit builder card was great, and the interest rates were great. Now they've removed or kneecapped all those features. Who knows what's next. Also the new app design is horrendous and makes it harder to know where my money is and how much I have. I used to recommend this bank to my friends, now I recommend you look elsewhere, I know I am.

Absolutely love this app and it's functions. There are definitely a few things missing - a dark mode is very needed (AMOLED mode would be even better!), a way to add profile photos to your account, and, this is the biggest - the ability to auto distribute money to pockets. So to pay bills, it automatically puts an X amount thst I set that would cover my bills entirely! I would LOVE to have more than one card design - I have the second card design and it is so l, so much better than the new one.

I loved this app. Past tense. ONE totally obliterated their app back in September, stripping it of all its features, like virtual cards, overdraft, and even a running balance. All gone. They also switched from an email/password login to text verification as to make their app unlinkable through plaid. Now it's buggy and shady. This app is trash. Don't bother.

I used to love my One account. But ever since they sold out, they've made so many changes, and a lot of the features I had come to really use are now unable to be used because they've gotten rid of them. I also do not like the layout of the new app. It's annoying and not intuitive like the old app. Fantastic work destroying a really awesome experience. Edit, Now the app keeps wanting a code from my phone number. Getting more and more annoying. Time to dump One sadly.

Bank is great! The app is terrible after the update! It wants to send a code to your email or text but when you such apps to check either one for the code, One closes and makes you sign back in and goes thru the process again. Please fix. I need to be able top access my account without being in front of a computer or different device. Can y'all please fix the app so I can use my bank without having to log on to a computer?!? At least allow the app to open while I switch to my messages or email!

ONE can't even call itself a bank. Like a lot of others, I went to One after Simple closed. For years, it was great. Not as good as Simple, but very close. Since Walmart acquired them though, it's gotten worse and worse. Every couple of months, a feature gets removed. Now, someone wrote me a check and you just can't deposit checks anymore - you need to transfer it from an external account. Why bother with ONE and not just the external account at that point?

This app seems to lose a star every time I update it. The ability to create unlimited pockets, which could be turned on/off at will (pocket protector) and the ability to automatically save up to 10% of your paychecks at an even higher APY were removed long ago and have not returned. Now, it keeps sending me unwanted notifications for "offers", and there is no way to mute offer notifications without also muting important notifications. Worse still, mobile check deposit doesn't work either.
data.replyText: Hi there, thank you for providing your feedback about the app. We appreciate it and have shared this with our team.

data.text: This app was a great option for making several pocket accounts, depositing checks, transfer from app-to-app and having virtual cards. I loved the options it provided, especially since it was a great substitute for the Simple Card, which was bought out in 2014. Now all of the features that I wanted from this app are gone and it is LITERALLY useless. Thanks One Financial for not asking what the customers wanted. Next time put a poll on Twitter or Reddit.

The bank itself, is good. The new app design is awful. It's hard to navigate, not intuitive, and just complicated. The old version was so much better - please give us it back. The landing page does not show all of your accounts, in fact, nowhere does. It feels zoomed in and crowded. Since this is a digital bank, having to rely on a terribly designed app is a big problem. I probably would not have signed up if this is what it looked like when I was choosing a bank. Please fix. Or just undo.

Very seamless experience! One has simplified the process of managing a debit card, credit card, joint accounts, and savings accounts. No longer do I need to worry about whether my paycheck has arrived when making a purchase, since One gives me an automatic credit line that it dips into until my paycheck arrives. At that point it gets automatically paid, removing one more thing to worry about. Highly recommend!

They keep removing features. When I signed up the app had an option to send a check to someone from the app and the option to deposit checks via mobile deposit. (The button is still there, though, so it'll trick you into trying and getting an error repeatedly.) Both of those features are gone now. It's fast becoming the case that this is only good for long term online savings, because it's no longer equipped to be a real banking option.

First off, One Finance (the company) is great. But I just got the new version of the mobile app, and it's just.. bad. Not intuitively organized, not attractive. The icons are confusing. The information which is presented is unclear and information (or more context) which would be useful is missing. One Finance, feel free hit me up and I'll give you more in depth feedback.

I loved One and have been using it for several years, after coming from Simple. I really dislike the new update. I seem to have lost many features (where is credit builder?, I can't edit auto-save amount, I can't change which pocket my card points to, credit line is hidden in settings) are these features returning? There was absolutely no prior notice from One (up to this point they have always communicated upcoming changes) This service was amazing, and this is truly disappointing change.

This new update is awful. I have to fight to login.. I verify my account and errors out when it wants me to setup a pin. I eventually get past it but then it happens again the next time. The color scheme is fine, but the layout is confusing. The features that caused me to come to One from Simple when they closed are all but eliminated now. Pockets are now limited to 3 max, no option to change physical card anymore. Horrible. So bad, I've sideloaded the old version app to use. disappointed

Another former Simple customer here. As others have mentioned, the app is a little too simple [no pun intended], but it gets the job done. Hopefully mobile check deposit launches soon and it'd be nice to have customizable notifications. It seems to be all or nothing at the moment. I don't need to be notified for spending $10 at Chipotle, but would like to know when a large transfer or paycheck deposits.

It seems like the update is causing a lot of issues. The older version was definitely better. The updated design takes you back 10-15 years. Also the app has an issue everytime I sign on. I have to force close it, and sometimes it completely signs me out without notice. The only thing I like is the autosave option. Please bring back the old design and savings pockets.

Another Simple transfer here. ONE was fantastic when I started using it last year and the features really drew us in. Loved the pocket design, ability to assign virtual cards, and share pockets with friends and family. After this newest update, all of the standout features are gone. Hopefully they will see all the poor reviews and think to go back to what they once were. If not I'm sure I'll be looking into a new service.

Used to be 5 stars but this latest update is not good. Minor: The list of pockets is back to not being alphabetical. Major: you can not see the whole virtual card number on the mobile app (on desktop you can), that feature is completely useless if you can't see the last four numbers. Major: The ability to point your physical card at any pocket is gone! The first two things tell me that you don't have very good automated testing in your software. Starting to wonder if it's time to move on.

One seemed rather easy to use. But then the problems starting showing themselves. The app is unstable! First, the support chat times out even if you manage to get a real representative so good luck describing your issue. Second,I need to report my card as lost and cannot because that particular button (along with a few others on the My Card tab) immediately crash the app. Please read this and fix these issues fast!
data.replyText: Hi there! Sincerest apologies for the issues you are experiencing. Please reach out to us at https://help.onefinance.com/ so we can help.

data.text: I loved this app when I started using it last year. Everything was intuitive, you could see all your money at once, and you could change which pocket you eere spending from. Now, the GUI is unintuitive, you can't see all your money on one screen like you used to, and spending is limited to only one pocket. It also looms bad from an aesthetic perspective and lacks personality. If I knew the update was going to be this bad, I would've kept the old version.

I used to really like this app (I ran here after Simple closed it's doors) and this new update has absolutely killed everything I liked about this service. Namely, the ability to use pockets and being able to switch my physical card to whatever pocket I was using for that bit of budget. it also looks like they're getting rid of the autosave feature too :((. If they don't fix this I'm going to have to start looking elsewhere. I'm Not happy about the lack of communication about these changes.

Yikes with the most recent update. Pockets no longer sorted alphabetically, can't edit the amount of my auto save pocket (are you getting rid of this service????), can't transfer funds. I switched to this platform because it was a huge help for budgeting and offered everything I needed. Now I guess I need to start looking for an alternative again. Disappointed üòû

I am completely 100% disappointed and the changes they made to this app. I was so happy with my banking app, my secured credit card, the transfer weekly to my auto save app from the direct deposit of my paycheck, and so many other things that the previous version of One finance had to offer. Also, the layout of the app previously I found to be mature and very easy to understand and interact with. I hope you guys aren't too proud of the new version. Be humble. Change it back.

The old version of the app was better. I liked the auto-save feature for direct deposits. I also liked that I could add notes to my transfers so later I could go back and see what it was for. They removed both of those features. I also liked being able to see all my pockets from one screen. Now I have to switch between 2 screens to see what's going on.
data.replyText: We are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback. If there is anything specific we can look into, please contact us at https://help.onefinance.com/.

data.text: New interface is an absolute mess, it used to be just fine, super straight forward and easy to navigate. Getting used to where they moved everything took a minute or two but wasn't too bad, but everything else is so difficult for no reason, and now it won't let me into my account, my biometrics no longer work, so I manually log in and it keeps me on a "finishing up" page until I give up and leave. Your app was completely fine and easy to work with, why change it?

Gave them a shot when Simple closed down. Good at first, continued to improve. Until it didn't. Just sort of plateaued at OK, until they took away everyone's credit like with literally no advanced notice (this happened to me right in the middle of a truck buying process and througna huge wrench into it). Now I find out they been bought out, so it's time to bail to a local credit union. Oh, the app has been glitchy lately as well.
data.replyText: Hi Todd - thank you for the feedback; which we've shared with the team. If we can be of any assistance or answer any questions, please reach out to our customer service team at https://help.onefinance.com/.

data.text: Terrible app after the September 2022 update. They took away assigning your card to different pockets, they took away shared spending pockets, they added a very low pocket number limit. They did add 1% interest for all pockets, they used to get zero. I guess that is nice. The interface redesign is very bad in most people's opinion. Large font size and lots of white space, meaning more scrolling and seeing less on the screen. Way less settings and configuration, very poor user support.

I used to be really happy with One, but now they're getting rid of things I loved like the autosave option. I didn't even realize that they had gotten rid of some features, so I wish communication was more clear. But the late update just killed it. The app used to be great, attractive and intuitive. Now it's so bad that it's hard to look at and nothing makes sense. I hope they change things back to how they were or I might be switching banks (yet again).

Aweful. Stopped loading on the two wifi networks I use. My data is bad so it's almost impossible to access my account. The app also makes it impossible to pay credit to them. If you try to pay between dates it doesn't count towards the debt. It will have a minimum due until the day of then it goes to $0 and won't let you pay anything. Trying to find a different bank now.

I really love One Finance, this review is only relevant to the app. And the app is decent, honestly. My only complaint is that it's become a little wonky lately. It's been slow to load (which I can live with for the most part), but the thing really bothering me is that the Biometric Login won't quit resetting. This reset in combination with slow load time kind of makes the mobile app useless when you're out and about, which is ideally when it'd be its most useful. Hope this gets worked out!
data.replyText: Hi Jennifer - thank you for the feedback. We'd like to learn a bit more about your experience so we can help get it fixed. If you have not already done so, please reach out to our team at https://help.onefinance.com/. Thank you!

data.text: One was purchased by Walmart and they've since removed every feature that made One great. The recent overhaul to the app might just be the least user friendly change I've ever seen -- everything in the app moved, is far less intuitive than before. If you're trying to decide whether to use One or not, stay away. There are far better options.

The new app UI is terrible! I migrated to One from Simple, where I was a customer as well as an employee. I had a really good setup in the app, and the new version layout is really bad. There's not enough information displayed, they've drastically altered the info layout, got rid of text labels, I can't see all om my pockets in one go anymore, and it just feels clunky. I stayed through the Walmart acquisition and the announcement of changes to pockets and auto-save, but this is too far. üò≠üò≠üò≠

This was the single best banking app I've ever used, and became dependent on it's features for budgeting, including splitting rent and bills with my roommate I had convinced to create a One account. Then, apparently Walmart decided to buy it, and completely removed like 90% of all the features that were literally the reason so many people started using this banking service. I'm currently looking for a replacement that has similar features to what One USE to have.

Really loved the app and the bank but after the new update, I'm like the other reviews- it sucks. It's just bad. I can't do things I used to be able to; it's harder to navigate; the font and colors are aggressively bad for my neurodivergent brain. I had been in the pieces of making pockets for each of my kids for their allowances and that's just not an option anymore even though it was a huge selling point before. It's so so bad. If I could uninstall an update, I would in a heartbeat. Pls fix

Everything that had made this a great bank has since been gutted leaving a hollow barely functioning app with a horrible downgrade in the UI. It would have been better to do nothing than make the changes that were made. One finance was there for me after the fall of Simple, for which I'm grateful and I genuinely enjoyed my time with One but I can see the writing on the wall. I'll be looking for other options

The app works well enough, but there are too many animations that slow down the experience. One changed the mobile interface away from having the transfer options along the top of the screen to a button in the bottom right corner weeks ago, yet I'm still getting the animation moving them from place to place almost every time I open the app.
data.replyText: We're sorry to hear that and we would love to take a look at this for you. Please reach out to our customer support team at support@one.app.

data.text: After transitioning from the now defunct Simple online bank, I was hesitant to enthusiastically endorse One right away. Now I am comfortable saying One is the best! Their intuitive app design, abundant saving features and ease of use with a family member(my wife) make this the perfect option for our banking needs. I try and use my One card as frequently as possible (charge instead of pin debit) so they get the most back in return. I never thought I'd say this to a bank, but thank you One!

The banking itself is fine, though some of the changes are confusing, but the worst part is definitely the app. They dumbed it down when it didn't need to change. No customization options seems strange as well. I'd like to see something as simple as changing the default account that opens upon launching the app (Save instead of Spend)
data.replyText: Thanks for your review! Some great feedback here. It has been shared with the team.

data.text: I am disappointed to change my 5 star to a 1 star. The pocket system was an absolute wonder. With the help of their pocket system, I was able to fix my budget, pay bills directly from pockets, manage my money efficiently, and buy a house. The layout was simple, everything was accessible and easy to find. Credit builder was a great tool that helped my credit. Everything that made One an incredible stand out and something I highly encouraged friends and colleagues to use, is now gone. A shame.

September 2022 update was even worse than advertised. Not only did they cap custom Pockets at 3, block sharing the Spend pocket, and drop reassigning the physical card. Oh, no. Virtual cards are discontinued too, as is sharing ANY pocket, period. Also Auto-Save, send-a-check, Pay Anyone, transfer memos, running Pocket balances, even the alphabetical Pocket sorting - all (G)ONE. All in exchange for 1 year of 2% back at Walmart. Pathetic. And the new UI design is a huge step back, too.

App is great, and the banking experience has been good so far. Liking the separate account numbers for pockets and being able to assign the card to specific ones. The only thing I would change is to add a widget so you can easily keep track of your balance. Please add a current balance widget or a customizable widget where you can choose which pockets to show!

It's OK. I like the pocket saving feature but I wish it was like Simple Bank, where it could automatically come out of your direct deposit. Also wish it would tell you how much to save for a goal like Simple Bank had. It would be nice to see that feature to stay on top of savings for goals. When I tried to open certain things in the app, it directs me to a webpage and takes me out of the app. The UI feels weird and a little janky at times. Deposit check feature should have been out sooner too.
data.replyText: Hi Julius - thank you for reaching out! We've just released a new feature called "Money Movement" which allows you to initiate a transfer when a direct deposit is received. Here is a link with more information: https://help.onefinance.com/hc/en-us/articles/4405807843351. Please reach out at help.onefinance.com if we can ever be of any assistance.

data.text: Terrible redesign and where is the search tool promised forever ago?! I'm a simple bank transfer and was liking One enough to stick around and see where it goes, but this new update is just awful. Just some of my gripes: Spend pocket should be with all of the others, Going into a specific transaction and pressing back reloads all of the transactions and losses you're place in the list, text is way too large and not information dense enough, need custom icons for pictures for pockets. Please fix.

I transitioned to this bank about a month ago from Simple (RIP) in pursuit of an experience that is similar/better than the bank I used before. This bank has some really useful features such as auto-save and 'pockets,' which I adore. The only issues I have is that the app experience is not as fluid as I liked it to be. Finding an ATM feature is disasterly difficult to use, interface is a little too simple, and others. This bank is in no way bad, but being online only, it needs an amazing app.

The new update has made the app prettier, but harder to use. The new design isn't really intuitive. To find the account and routing numbers you have to hit 'edit' which makes no sense. I'd literally give anything to have Simple back. I feel like many of your users came from the death of Simple, and these changes feel like your app is going the same way. It's disappointing because the app itself was literally perfect before this.

The new ownership and vast feature reduction makes this like any other online banking app. It WAS easily the best online banking app before they took away choosing which pocket card swipes deducts from, unlimited pockets, sharing pockets with others, virtual credit cards, individual account numbers per pocket, credit line, and 3% APY savings. Also, the new app sucks. The font hierarchy is terrible. Everything looks super important when it's not. Basic features are tucked away. Just bad.

Update: Left this bank for a new one. The rebranding of the app needs to be snapshotted back to the old version and update the color palette to match the brand. There's useless space everywhere and no way to create a pocket, card, or manage my profile and current card. Please just push the old version back it was tremendously better in design and user experience. Thank you. 10+ years a FS software/mobile developer loved the UI and it got wrecked. Filled out feedback form got no action.

Hate the new update which came about with no prior communication from ONE. Spend Pockets have been redesigned to now function as save pockets. Debit cards can no longer be reassigned to different pockets for spending. Essentially, the entire way this app, and its features were intended to be used has all changed making it difficult to continue using as we have been. Will be looking into other banking options. Very disappointed.

Zelle. That's what would make this infinitely more awesome. Original review: Have you seen these Pockets? This may change, but as of now, I like this app. I switched from Simple cuz they've shut down unfortunately. There wasn't much of a learning curve to navigate One. If anything, it's more simple than Simple and more user friendly. Also, unlike Varo, the biometrics log in works. Password. Everything seems to be in working order. Recommend. :)

Went over to One after Simple closed up and One was great at first, but the changes and updates over the course of last year have been awful. Credit cards being dropped, UX on mobile has become cumbersome, pocket sharing getting muddled, and now I see that I can't do check deposits now?? I'm done with One, I'm shopping for a new bank this year. Great job breaking what didn't need fixed, folks.

Update: I left One at the beginning of the year. Put my savings at Vio Bank at 4.8% APY, and went back to a brick and mortar bank for checking. One was great at first. Then they changed their features and app. Then they were bad. *end of update* Please go back to the old app. This new one is awful. Also, please restore the old features (sharing spend pockets, auto save, etc.). I really liked One, and I really don't want to go through the hassle of changing banks again.
data.replyText: Thank you for sharing your feedback.

data.text: One used to be great. But these recent changes? I'm planning to jump ship as soon as I find another. Lost: recatagorizing transactions pocket creation Creating new virtual cards It makes 0 sense for these changes. It's a 180. We're moving backwards. If you're new, find somewhere else. Go with a credit union. OneFinance is headed for decline.

As so many others that have been with One before the buyout, the App has become like so many other banking apps. Pockets and virtual cards, coupled with auto-save were game changers for budgeting. Once Walmart acquired earlier this year, the features disappeared and app has become buggy. If you're looking for a new online bank, don't get One.

Okay, first, One WAS an awesome bank. Best I'd ever had. However, I can't say that anymore. They took away literally every good feature with their new "update." The new app layout that came out Sep 2022 is genuinely awful. The colors are aesthetics are kind of maybe cool, sure, but it has 0 functionality compared to the previous one. AND ALL THE BEST FEATURES WERE TAKEN AWAY!!! It's just another generic bank now and I hate it. Bring back the old features like pockets and virtual cards.

We started using One after Simple. Since a lot of the online banking options don't have features for sharing an account, this had been a wonderful option. I loved being able to create virtual cards and a separate pocket just for bills and another for me and my partner. We were blindsided ad we didn't get notice that drastic changes were happening. Neither of us got notified.

Used to be a 5 star but with the recent update which is more of a downgrade they lost one of the most important features which was card assignment to any pocket and now without that feature and others that were lost, it now makes the app more difficult to use and almost pointless. I had my in-laws setup on it and got it setup to help them budget but now we might be looking for another option unless they bring back the card assignment and actually put some new features to said update.

I really love the simplicity... But for the love of all that's holy, stop changing the app icon color. Are your designers fighting over there? Product vs Marketing? My card is yellow, so I still instinctively look for the yellow app icon, then after I can't find it remember it was changed to dark purple (that's a wild brand shift while keeping the logo the same ü•¥), and today I found it's blue like every other app ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòµ‚Äçüí´? What's going on?? Stop changing the color! Choose one and let it live.
data.replyText: Thanks for your review! Your feedback is appreciated!

data.text: Still really upset with the changes and we are actively waiting for something better to come out and switch to. Downsides: 1) I now have to make a transfer for every single transaction and pocket replenishment (12/mo just to replenish). 2)I have to wait about 5 seconds after every transfer just for a message to be displayed. Can't swipe it away. 3) Transfers are set so Spend is the default to pocket, but 99% of the time that is not what I am transferring to. Why can't I set my own default?

I loved One - at first. Came to One from Simple, and loved it at first. Then they took away the overdraft credit line with ZERO notice, and cost me a credit line due to 2 NSF's that wouldn't have happened if I had just known it wasn't going to be covered. Then they cancelled a bank transfer because I did 2 in one day into two different pockets. They thought it was fraud so they cancelled one of them, resulting in an account being overdrawn. Now they took the balance widget away from the app.

Simple to One transfer here. How my husband and I loved this app after switching from Simple. We even said it was better! Features were beautiful, we loved being able to add each other to pockets and keep our individual money and daughter's money for school, extracurriculares, etc. Everything was smooth. Now? OMG no warning, not an email that a switch was even happening and since, nothing has been the same. Everything that made One amazing was taken away. We're are honestly looking to switch.

Ruined a great app. One used to simplify my finances. Since Walmart took over the whole system is no longer helpful and just makes it hard to see where my money is. They also removed the 'pocket protect' feature, which moved money to cover a transaction in a pocket. The UI is terrible. Logging in is more complicated and even though I have biometric login enabled, it rarely works and makes me log in and enter a code texted to me. Why buy something just to remove everything that makes it good?

Love the concept of this banking app. The ability to organize money in pockets is very convenient and the interest on savings accounts is better than brick and mortar banks. The new update is disappointing though. Not having the ability to see all accounts on one screen is very limiting and makes the app less user friendly. The loss of 10% paycheck autosave is also very disappointing. Overall a cool concept and decent bank option though.

Changing from 5 star to 1 star. One recently took away many of their best features like pocket sharing and assigning your debit card to a pocket. In addition, their recent updates of the app are clunky and childish. It's not organized thoughtfully, the font is terrible...I honestly don't understand what they were thinking with these changes. This is extremely frustrating and my partner and I will be looking for different options if these features are not fixed. Incredibly disappointing.

ONE sold the company and gutted all the features. It's basically now a glorified prepaid card. After the same thing happened a year before with Simple, this was the last straw. I cancelled it and opened an account with a credit union. I can't keep changing up my accounts every couple of years when these online banks fold, nobody has time for that. Find the best credit union in your area and don't look back!

Since the Walmart update most of the features that drew me to ONE have been cut or are seriously restricted. I am lucky that I created lots of pockets prior to the update being pushed, otherwise I'd be limited to only 3 pockets. Absolutely hate that I have to navigate between two different menus to see all of my accounts, I much preferred when my spend, pockets, and savings accounts were all in the same place. This review wouldn't be complete without mentioning how bad the interface looks now.

ONE is lowering interest offered to customers while interest rates are going up. They should be increasing interest rates. This tells me the company is in some kind of trouble. REMOVE YOUR MONEY! They have completely ruined the app the the newest update. Not intuitive or easy to use. Colors are awful and it looks just terrible. They got rid of all the features that set them apart like creating pockets and auto-save. There is no difference from this bank or any other digital banks anymore
data.replyText: Hi Erick - thank you for the feedback! We've shared this with the team and will be sure to let everyone know if we make a change. Our team is available at help.onefinance.com if we can ever be of any assistance with your One account.

data.text: Coming from another financial institution that offered budgeting features, ONE offers essentials and some additional perks. my favorite aspect of this bank is that I can set up individual "pocket", each with their own unique acct #. This allows me to easily allocate funds for each one of my auto-payments and forget about it. ONE takes the thinking out of budgeting, which is so convenient. Thanks ONE!

Pure trash since the redesign and the WM acquisition. My particular issue: the notification whenever I made a purchase used to show how much money was left in the pocket but it's gone now. Do not trust fintechs, they will sell out at the earliest moment. Happened with Simple, happened to One. Closing my account at the earliest moment.

Off to a bad start. Find ATM button not working in app. On top of that, the biometrics had a weird instance when opening the app from the background process, leading it to getting stuck on the login screen. Also, One makes it rather hard to access their customer support from the app. If they improved in these three areas, I might have considered them over Ally Bank.
data.replyText: Hi Josh, thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. We're curious about a few items you mention from ATM button not working to challenges reaching the Customer team. We will reach out to you directly to see what we can learn and help resolve these items for and with you. Thanks again!

data.text: The app has been getting worse and worse. Now with the new version of the app it's absolute garbage. I have to go home and use my PC to use my bank. Somehow, they made a worse app than Huntington Bank. It's really scraping the bottom. It just simply doesn't work. I've restarted my phone, reset my network connection, cleared the cache, cleared the data, reinstalled the app. Nothing works.

Original review was 5 stars. The pocket system was wonderful; it made it super easy to pay for things directly from the pockets. We needed that for our home business. The latest update removed pocket access. They threw away the thing that made them unique and wonderful. Now I just tolerate it for the overdraft protection, which is the only good part left, so if you don't need that , don't bother switching. Congrats, One. Now you're almost as useless as your competition.

Edit: This app gets worse every update. I have to login every single time I use the app. I'm leaving if this bank is making me lose access to my money..... A once great product that has since disabled most of the offerings that made it great, multiple of which vanished over night: credit line, creating several pockets (ie, 10+ for budgeting), dedicated virtual cards per pocket, shared pockets, auto-save, sending checks (ie, for bills), credit score tracking - all gone.

I enjoyed this when I got it last year. I spent a lot of time searching for an online bank with the features I wanted and a good app. Loved it all up until the new update for the phone app. Sorry guys, but it's bad now. It's ugly, it's not easy to navigate, and it's not the sleek, clean look that sold me on choosing this app. I don't like how the spend and save accounts are split between two screens, it was more convenient when it was all on one. It just feels like I'm using a cartoon now.

This app used to be amazing, they have removed a TON of features, I can't reliably sign in anymore and tbh the pockets used to be the focus, they hid them in a second tab, the new ui is weirdly oversized on my screen. No longer being able to assign my physical card to a pocket is a HUGE loss, and the recurring transfers all have to be reset up because they didn't bother to make the new v backwards compatible. They went from 5000000 out of 10 high recommend to everyone I met. To being -500000

Great bank, but the new app is dogsh*t. Constant errors, if you open the app again without completely shutting it down and ending the task, it simply won't load. When it is working, the new layout is clunky and not intuitive. Whatever genius decided the mobile app needed an update is not doing you any favors. Edit: Just updating to say that issues persist through Oct 7 version of app.

Since selling out to Walmart, One has only gotten worse and worse. First they removed a BUNCH of features that were the entire reason I switched to One, then they replaced the clean and modern UI with this ugly dated looking thing, and now I find out they're going to start charging fees and cutting their savings interest rate. Good job. You completely ruined a good thing. I'm out.

It's still early and in no way perfect, but they are making regular updates and it keeps improving. Budgeting isn't about poorly categorizing where your money went; it's about defining where it should go. Their "Pockets" are a digital version of envelope budgeting and the spend pocket is essentially your discretionary spending that is safe to spend. This keeps you in track to keep funds for living expenses, structure debt, and with their save packets, secure your future. ONE is a great bank!

They have removed every feature that made One so good. No more shared pockets for budgeting with a spouse or housemate. No more virtual cards to set up for recurring payments. No more assigning the debit to a pocket to pull money from there when you're on the go which we used all the time for our grocery and food budgets. I thought One was the answer for former Simple Bank customers, but time to find another bank again. I hope One is listening to this feedback.
data.replyText: Thanks for your review. Your feedback is being shared and heard by our team.

data.text: ONE has removed the auto-save feature, credit line, ability to "point" physical card to any pocket, virtual cards, pay anyone feature, ability to deposit checks, ability to lock pockets, credit builder, view credit score, and scheduled transfers, among other tools...And they now require $500 of qualifying direct deposits. I am, therefore, leaving ONE. For anyone searching for a better bank, look into Qube and SoFi.

The new app is terrible. Harder to find things, app doesn't refresh and is just blank when switching apps and coming back. And about the features, they removed pocket protection, removed auto save, not sure what else. I guess nothing good lasts anymore. All these companies care about is making as much money as possible in the short term.

Holy WOW this app is ugly. It was great and the app used to be a big reason i stayed with this bank. After their merger/acquisition or whatever, things were still fine, basic features and workflow were still there, minus a few features that were cool but i could do without. Most recent update totally replaced the app with something completely different, and now some important features are gone like pocket sharing. Can't see all my accounts at once which is very disappointing.
